comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Poor resolution copy of an image of Vought RF-8G Crusader from Reserve VFP-306 Modex 604 With ancient Greek style tail code ND of Carrier Air Reserve Wing Thirty (CVWR-30) Navy serial number outlined in white on black painted tail may be interpreted as 146865. VFP-306 RF-8G 146865. The RF-8G was the longest-serving US Crusader, long after the fighter versions had been withdrawn. The last active duty Navy unit to fly the RF-8G was VFP-63 in June 1982. The RF-8G flew even longer with the Naval Air Reserve. Naval Air Reserve units operating the RF-8G were VFP-206 and VFP-306, both based at NAF Washington DC, stationed at Andrews AFB. VFP-306 disestablished in September 1984. VFP-206 gave up its RF-8Gs on March 29, 1987, becoming the last Navy unit to fly the Crusader. 1975 picture of RF-8G 146865: www.aeroslides.com/auction/pictures/AU-53.jpg RF-8G 146865 VFP-63 DET 3 601 AC NAS MIRAMAR May 1975 A better quality picture of RF-8G with VFP-308 as Modex 605 may be viewed here: s362974870.onlinehome.us/forums/air/index.php?showtopic=1... img.photobucket.com/albums/v20/jinxx1/F-8%20Crusader/RF-8... RF-8G 146865 was retired to the then MASDC near Tucson Arizona on 22 February 1982 with inventory code .AN2F0421 and location; Area 18, Row 6, Position 5. Pictures of RF-8G 146865 in desert storage after retirement:: www.airliners.net/photo/0879651/ www.airfighters.com/photo/5329/M/USA-Navy/Vought-RF-8G-Cr... www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Vought-RF-8G-Crusader/...
